en: Louvre G 44
thumbnail
https://iiif.perseus.tufts.edu/iiif/3/1992.06.0646/full/pct:20/0/default.png
View of side B
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side B, from the right
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of the right side
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top view; the tondo shows a satyr with a maenad
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Close-up view of the tondo: a nude, ithyphallic, balding, bearded satyr, leans profile to the right, toward a woman who runs to the right, but turns her head profile to the left, to look at the satyr; she wears a short himation over a medium-sleeved chiton, while a sakkos covers her hair, and carries a kantharos in her right hand, and a thyrsos in her left hand
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of the tondo, top left: the torso and head of a nude, ithyphallic, balding, bearded satyr, leans profile to the right
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Bottom view: a rounded palmette, enclosed in a tendril, fills the space beneath each handle
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side A, from below: two youths on either side of a horse, who stands in front of a column
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Detail of side A, left: a youth, standing in a frontal pose, leaning on a staff under his left arm, and wearing a himation, turns his head profile to the right, and thrusts the palm of his hand, shown in a rare frontal pose, out towards the viewer; to his right stands another youth, dressed in Thracian boots (embades), a chitoniskos belted over a long overfold, a chlamys, and a (Thracian) fox-skin hat, reaches to the right, to stroke the nose of his horse
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Detail of side A, center: a horse stands profile to the left, in front of a schematic Ionic capital, supporting a narrow entablature; the horse is somewhat agitated, as indicated by his advancing left foot and the open lips
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Detail of side A, right of center: a youth, standing in a 3/4-view to the left, but leaning on a staff below his left arm, turns his head profile to the right, to look at another youth, who stands in near profile to the left, holds a staff in his left hand, and gestures with his opened right palm; both wear himatia
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side B, from below: a man with youths
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

View of side B, left: two youths, wearing himatia, stand together and talk; the first is shown frontally, with his head turned profile to the right; he rests his right hand on his hip and holds a staff in his lowered left hand; the second youth stands profile to the left, facing him, and points his finger aggressively at the first youth
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

View of side B, center: a bearded man, wearing a himation around his legs and lower torso, sits profile to the right on a stool (diphros), rests his left hand on a staff, and holds his right hand over his head
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

View of side B, right: two youths, both wrapped in himation, stand together; the first, show profile to the left, tilts his head down slightly, and holds a staff beneath his right arm; the second, standing in a frontal pose, with his head turned profile to the right, reaches to touch the first youth on the shoulder
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side A
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side A, from the right
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of the right side
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side B, from the left
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side B
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side B, from the right
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of the left side
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
View of side A, from the left
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Close-up view of the figural scene on side A: a warrior, mounting a chariot
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Detail of side A, left: a warrior, shown profile to the right, wearing a short cuirass over a short -sleeved chitoniskos, and an Attic helmet, stepping up to the platform of a quadriga (chariot), holding the reins in both hands, and a whip in his right hand
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, top left: upper half of a warrior
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, top left: upper half of a warrior; note the inscription, <Foreign lang=Greek>*D*A[*M]*A*S* =</Foreing>, next to his head
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, bottom left: chariotbox
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Detail of side A, left of center: bearded warrior, wearing a cuirass over a short-sleeved chitoniskos, and a Corinthian helmet, standing behind the horses, near profile to the left; he is armed with a shield emblazoned with a black silhouette sphinx, and a spear
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, left of center, above: upper half of bearded warrior (note the snake emblazoned on the crest of his Corinthian helmet)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, center: chariot hardware
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, center, below: inscription, <Foreign lang=Greek>*S*O*S*I*S</Foreign>, between legs of two horses
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, center, above: heads and necks of two horses
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, top right: heads and necks of two horses, above the head of a boy (note inscription)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side A, bottom right: a boy, standing in 3/4-view to the left, wearing a himation draped over his left shoulder, and holding his right hand up
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Close-up view of the figural scene on side B: a woman between a man and a youth
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Detail of side B, left: a bearded man, wearing a himation draped over his left shoulder, standing in 3/4-view to the right, with his ankles crossed; he rests his right hand on his hip, and leans on a staff under his left arm
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side B, upper left: upper half of bearded man
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side B, left: inscription between man and woman
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Detail of side B, center: a woman, standing near profile to the right, wearing a himation partially veiled over her head, over a medium-sleeved chiton; she holds a red wreath between both upraised hands
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side B, center: upper half of a woman; note the red wreath that she holds between both upraised hands
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side B, right of center: a woman presents a red wreath to a youth who faces her and rests his right hand on a knotty staff or cane; note the red dipinto in the field
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side B, right: a youth standing in 3/4-view to the left, resting his right hand on a staff, while he holds his left hand at waist level
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of side B, top right: upper half of a youth standing in 3/4-view to the left
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of resting surface, with graffito (bottom left)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
